options.name: Corpsman
options.description: Gain +1 Medicine and +1 Resilience. You can stabilize a dying creature as a bonus action.

options.name: Combat Medic
options.description: Gain +1 Medicine. When you use a medical ability on an ally in combat, you don't provoke opportunity attacks.

options.name: Triage Expert
options.description: Gain +1 Resilience. You can quickly assess multiple casualties and prioritize treatment. You can stabilize up to three dying creatures as a single action.

options.name: Battlefield Treatment
options.description: Gain +1 Medicine and +1 Physical Mitigation. Your medical abilities can be used while under fire without penalty.

options.name: Action : Emergency Evac
options.description: You can move a wounded ally up to half your movement speed without provoking opportunity attacks. The ally gains temporary hit points equal to your Medicine modifier until the end of your next turn.

options.name: Reaction : Trauma Response
options.description: When an ally within 30 feet takes damage that would reduce them to 0 hit points, you can use your reaction to rush to them and keep them at 1 hit point instead.

options.name: Advanced Field Medicine
options.description: Gain +1 Medicine and +1 Resilience. You can cure one disease, poison effect, or condition when treating a wounded ally in addition to healing them.

options.name: Action : Mass Casualty Response
options.description: You can treat up to three allies within 30 feet simultaneously. Each ally regains hit points equal to 2d6 + your Medicine modifier.

options.name: Medical Innovation
options.description: Gain +1 Medicine and +1 Science. You can improvise medical supplies from available materials, never suffering penalties for lack of proper medical equipment.

options.name: Master Corpsman
options.description: Gain +1 Medicine and +1 Resilience. Your healing abilities restore an additional 2d8 hit points. Once per combat, you can revive a fallen ally as an action, returning them to half their maximum hit points.
